titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Helen Evertson Smith Papers
circa 1762-circa 1904
MS 574
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:45 -0400.

did.abstract:
Correspondence and papers of various members of the Smith family of Sharon, Connecticut, particularly: John Cotton Smith, lawyer and governor of Connecticut; his son William Mather Smith; Rev. John Cotton Smith, Protestant Episcopal clergyman; and Helen Evertson Smith's own correspondence and papers, including typescripts of many of her articles on American colonial history, the Revolutionary War, loyalists, and social customs.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Helen E. Smith collection
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection is not processed. As part of a project conducted in 2019-20, archivist Elise Winks performed a high level survey of the collection and described it broadly in this preliminary finding aid.
